TopicTitle: Can't find an old delta-v calculator site?

Articles.Content:
Hey everyone!  For about the past year, I've been taking a break from KSP mainly because of work and interest in other games.  Now that I'm playing again, I seem to remember an old Delta-v calculator website that fit all my needs.  I remember it having an obscure and strange URL.  On the site, you could click on a picture of one of the planets, and then another picture of a planet, indicate whether it was from the surface or low orbit, and then it would give you the Delta-v needed.  There were also sliders. such as increasing the Delta-v needed by 15% to allow for error during a mission, etc...

Does anyone know the URL?  It would be incredibly useful.  I know that there are other calculators out there, but for some reason, I really preferred this one.

Thanks in advance, Snowstorm
@Snowstorm,have you checked KSP wiki?

Sorry, I don't recognize the specific one you describe, @Snowstorm.  However, you may want to take a look at this one:

http://ksp.olex.biz

Doesn't handle transfers from the surface, but it does provide a nice picture-of-planet graphical display for doing transfers between planets or moons.  Simple, quick and easy to use, does the job, it's my personal favorite.

Yes!  I found it by chance on one of my old computers.... here's the link if anyone is interested!

http://13375.de/KSPDeltaVMap/

On 14/02/2017 at 9:27 PM, Snowstorm said:

Yes!  I found it by chance on one of my old computers.... here's the link if anyone is interested!

http://13375.de/KSPDeltaVMap/

That's the one I've used for a long time now, appears to have stopped working. I found this one that's similar but doesn't work on my phone at all, shame really it was really handy.

 

https://www.dcl.hpi.uni-potsdam.de/home/feinbube/web/stealth/KSPDeltaVMap/
Was it this one? It's what I used for calculating DV before I started using KER.
